No, we're far too... discerning for that. I promote my events through... let's call them "selective channels." Word of mouth, whispers in dark alleys, cryptic messages on encrypted forums. We use coded language, veiled references to "high-stakes entertainment" and "exclusive gatherings." Only those who know the right people, who have the right connections, get invited to our little soirees.

We also use the allure of exclusivity to our advantage. People are drawn to the forbidden, the taboo. They want to be part of something that's not for the faint of heart, something that sets them apart from the common rabble. And that's exactly what we offer – a chance to witness, to participate in, something that's raw, unbridled, and utterly thrilling.

So, we vet our attendees carefully, making sure they're the right kind of people – those who can appreciate the art of dogfighting, who understand the value of what we're offering. And, of course, those who can keep their mouths shut.
